title: Authors and Citation
text: Fan Chen. Author, maintainer. Karl Rohe. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chen F, Rohe K (2023). gdim: Graph Dimensionality. https://github.com/RoheLab/gdim, https://rohelab.github.io/gdim/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gdim: Graph Dimensionality},   author = {Fan Chen and Karl Rohe},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/RoheLab/gdim, https://rohelab.github.io/gdim/}, }

title: Graph Dimensionality
text: gdim estimates graph dimension using cross-validated eigenvalues, via graph-splitting technique developed http://arxiv.org/abs/2108.03336. Theoretically, method works computing special type cross-validated eigenvalue follows simple central limit theorem. allows users perform hypothesis tests rank graph.

title: Graph Dimensionality
text: can install gdim GitHub :

title: Graph Dimensionality
text: eigcv() main function gdim. single required parameter function maximum possible dimension, k_max. following example, generate random graph stochastic block model (SBM) 1000 nodes 5 blocks (, expect estimated graph dimension 5). , adjacency matrix. Now, call eigcv() function k_max=10 estimate graph dimension. example, eigcv() suggests k=5. visualize result, use plot() returns ggplot object. function displays test statistic (z score) hypothesized graph dimension.
code: library(fastRG) #> Loading required package: Matrix  B <- matrix(0.1, 5, 5) diag(B) <- 0.3  model <- sbm(   n = 1000,   k = 5,   B = B,   expected_degree = 40,   poisson_edges = FALSE,   allow_self_loops = FALSE )  A <- sample_sparse(model) library(gdim)  eigcv_result <- eigcv(A, k_max = 10) eigcv_result #> Estimated graph dimension:    5 #>  #> Number of bootstraps:         10 #> Edge splitting probabaility:  0.1 #> Significance level:       0.05 #>  #>  ------------ Summary of Tests ------------ #>   k          z        pvals         padj #>   1 60.8793909 1.000000e-32 1.000000e-32 #>   2 12.9226104 1.000000e-32 1.000000e-32 #>   3 11.6415706 1.266538e-31 1.266538e-31 #>   4 11.5093016 5.921680e-31 5.921680e-31 #>   5 11.8647120 1.000000e-32 1.000000e-32 #>   6 -1.5356317 9.376856e-01 9.376856e-01 #>   7 -1.4952968 9.325815e-01 9.325815e-01 #>   8 -0.9315610 8.242183e-01 8.242183e-01 #>   9 -0.9875156 8.383050e-01 8.383050e-01 #>  10 -1.5758100 9.424652e-01 9.424652e-01 plot(eigcv_result)

title: Graph Dimensionality
text: Chen, Fan, Sebastien Roch, Karl Rohe, Shuqi Yu. “Estimating Graph Dimension Cross-Validated Eigenvalues.” ArXiv:2108.03336 [Cs, Math, Stat], August 6, 2021. http://arxiv.org/abs/2108.03336.

title: Refitted Quadrilateral — RQ
text: Calculate Refitted Quadrilateral (RQ) statistics.

title: Refitted Quadrilateral — RQ
text: matrix Matrix, adjacency matrix undirected network. label vector 1:K, community labels nodes.

title: Refitted Quadrilateral — RQ
text: RQ statistics.

title: Refitted Quadrilateral — RQ
text: Jin, Jiashun. Fast community detection SCORE. Ann. Statist. 43 (2015), . 1, 57--89. doi:10.1214/14-AOS1265. https://projecteuclid.org/euclid.aos/1416322036

title: Spectral Clustering On Ratios-of-Eigenvectors — SCORE
text: Perform Spectral Clustering Ratios--Eigenvectors (SCORE).

title: Spectral Clustering On Ratios-of-Eigenvectors — SCORE
code: SCORE(   A,   K,   truncate = log(nrow(A)),   iter.max = 1000,   nstart = 1000,   algorithm = "Hartigan-Wong",   trace = FALSE )

title: Spectral Clustering On Ratios-of-Eigenvectors — SCORE
text: matrix Matrix, adjacency matrix undirected network. K integer(1), number dimension. truncate numeric(1), truncate eigen-ratio (absolute value) matrix, default log(nrow()). Set 0 want truncation. iter.max maximum number iterations allowed. nstart centers number, many random sets     chosen? algorithm character: may abbreviated.  Note     "Lloyd" "Forgy" alternative names one     algorithm. trace logical integer number, currently used     default method ("Hartigan-Wong"): positive (true),     tracing information progress algorithm     produced.  Higher values may produce tracing information.

title: Spectral Clustering On Ratios-of-Eigenvectors — SCORE
text: vector 1:K, community labels nodes.

title: Spectral Clustering On Ratios-of-Eigenvectors — SCORE
text: Jin, Jiashun. Fast community detection SCORE. Ann. Statist. 43 (2015), . 1, 57--89. doi:10.1214/14-AOS1265. https://projecteuclid.org/euclid.aos/1416322036

title: Stepwise Goodness-of-Fit — StGoF
text: Perform stepwise goodness--fit (StGoF) tests graph dimension. tests run k=2, 3, ..., K_max separately. Given significance level (alpha), infered graph dimension determined first test (.e., smallest k) accepted.

title: Stepwise Goodness-of-Fit — StGoF
text: matrix Matrix, adjacency matrix undirected network. K_max integer(1), number communities. alpha numeric(1), significance level, default 0.05. Set alpha=1 want compute statistics 1 K_max.

title: Stepwise Goodness-of-Fit — StGoF
text: data.table three columns: k tested graph dimension. rq.stat refitted quadrilateral test statistics. p.value test p-value (two-sided, adjustment).

title: Stepwise Goodness-of-Fit — StGoF
text: Jin, Jiashun. Fast community detection SCORE. Ann. Statist. 43 (2015), . 1, 57--89. doi:10.1214/14-AOS1265. https://projecteuclid.org/euclid.aos/1416322036

title: Edge Bootstrapping and Splitting — eigcv
text: Estimate graph dimension via eigenvalue cross-validation (EigCV). graph dimension k first k eigenvectors adjacency matrix correlated population eigenspace, others . Edge bootstrapping sub-samples edges graph (without replacement). Edge splitting separates edges training part testing part.

title: Edge Bootstrapping and Splitting — eigcv
code: eigcv(   A,   k_max,   bootstrap = 10,   split = 0.1,   alpha = 0.05,   ptol = 1e-32,   correct = "none",   laplacian = TRUE,   regularize = TRUE,   align = FALSE,   trace = FALSE )

title: Edge Bootstrapping and Splitting — eigcv
text: adjacency matrix, coerced Matrix class. k_max integer(1), number eigenvectors compute. bootstrap integer(1), number graph bootstraps, default 10. Graph bootstrapping account randomness graph splitting, rather obtaining statistic (traditional bootstrap ). Hence, small number (e.g., 3~10) bootstraps usually suffices. bootstrap>1, test statistics averaged across bootstraps p-values calculated based averaged statistics. split numeric(1), proportion leave-edges (test set). Must take value (0,1). alpha numeric(1), significance level test, default 0.05. used cut dimension estimation. ptol numeric(1), tolerance minimal p-value. correct character(1), correction method multiple testing. recommended k_max large. See p.adjust acceptable values method. correct "none", returned summary table extra column called padj repeats p-value previous column. laplacian logical(1), use normalized regularized adjacency matrix (.e. L) regularize logical(1), return regularized symmetric Laplacian. default TRUE. ignored laplacian=FALSE. align logical(1), align trained singular vectors full graph. default FALSE. option experimental used caution. trace logical(1), diagnostic use. TRUE, return additionally cv_stats containing test statistics every bootstrap, align=TRUE, eigs full graph.

title: Edge Bootstrapping and Splitting — eigcv
text: eigcv object, contains: inference inferred graph dimension. summary summary table tests. bootstrap number bootstraps performed. split graph splitting probability used. alpha significance level test. trace trace=TRUE, bootstrapped statistics.

title: Graph Splitting — esplit
text: Randomly split edges graph two, proportional 1-split split.

title: Graph Splitting — esplit
text: adjacency matrix, coerced Matrix class. split numeric(1), proportion leave-edges (test set). Must take value (0,1).

title: Graph Splitting — esplit
text: list two Matrix elements: train subgraph 1-split portion edges. test subgraph split portion edges.

title: gdim: Graph Dimensionality — gdim-package
text: Estimate graph dimensionality using thecross-validated eigenvalues. cross-validated eigenvalues estimated splitting sample graph two, training test graph. training graph use estimate sample eigen eigenvectors, test graph use evaluate correlation sample eigenvectors eigenspace test graph (thus population eigenspace). test statistics graph dimensionality follows simple central limit theorem. p-values provided hypothesized graph dimensionality sequentially.

title: gdim: Graph Dimensionality — gdim-package
text: Maintainer: Fan Chen fan.chen@wisc.edu (ORCID) Authors: Karl Rohe karlrohe@stat.wisc.edu

title: Graph Dimension Statistic — gdstat
text: Given trained left/right singular vectors, compute test statistic graph dimension.

title: Graph Dimension Statistic — gdstat
text: full, test matrix Matrix, adjacency Laplacian matrix full test graphs. u, v numeric vector, trained left right singular vectors. split numeric(1), proportion leave-edges (test set). Must take value (0,1).

title: Graph Dimension Statistic — gdstat
text: numeric(3), test statistics

title: Graph Laplacian — glaplacian
text: Given m n graph adjacency matrix , calculate symmetric graph Laplacian.

title: Graph Laplacian — glaplacian
text: adjacency matrix, coerced Matrix class. regularize logical(1), return regularized symmetric Laplacian. default TRUE. ignored laplacian=FALSE.

title: Graph Spectral Decomposition — gspectral
text: Given ab m n graph matrix , find largest k singular values corresponding singular vectors.

title: Graph Spectral Decomposition — gspectral
text: adjacency matrix, coerced Matrix class. k integer(1), number eigenvalues. ... additonal parameters pass RSpectra::eigs (symmetric ) RSpectra::svds (asymmetric ).

title: Graph Spectral Decomposition — gspectral
text: list (see also RSpectra::svds): u m k matrix whose columns contain left singular vectors. v n k matrix whose columns contain right singular vectors.

text: x eigcv object. type either "z", "", "L" specify y-axis plot. "z", plot test statistics (asymptotic z score) k. "", plot x'Ax eigenvector x. "L", plot x'Lx eigenvector x. threshold numeric(1), cut-p-value (log10), default 2. ... ignored.
